INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Interventions standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing
a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation During the weekend of 12/16/22, youth assaulted staff member
because the staff member threatened to kill this youth and had pushed
youth.
2

Investigation I reviewed intake dated 12/20/2022. It states Youth A assaulted Staff
Person 1during the weekend of 12/16/2022 because Staff Person 1
allegedly threatened to kill Youth A and because Staff Person 1 pushed
Youth A. Youth A had no injuries.
I review incident report dated 12/18/2022. It states Youth A left the tv
lounge with the purpose to AWOL and that Staff Person 1 attempted to
verbally redirect him back. Staff Person 1 stood in front of the parking
lot door as Youth A repeatedly stated that he was going to kill Staff
Person 1 and that Youth A spit in the direction of Staff Person 1 at
which point he moved front in front of the door. Youth A then ran up to
Staff Person 1 and began punching him as he stood in a protective
stance. Staff Person 1 fell to the floor at which point Youth A was
scratched and that other staff and residents got Youth A off of Staff
Person 1. Notation indicates Youth A wanted to AWOL to smoke.
Police were contacted and an assault complaint was filed by Staff
Person 1.
I interviewed Youth A onsite on 12/20/2022 with DHHS Worker. He
reports placing a shoe in the stairway door so he could leave the facility
to go smoke and return later. He reports Staff Person 1 took the shoe
from the door, stood in the hallway, and that Youth A spit in the
direction of Staff Person 1, but not on him. He reports Staff Person 1
said, “If you spit on me, I’m going to kill you” and then pushed Youth A.
Youth A states that is when he started punching Staff Person 1 and that
Staff Person 1 was punching back. Youth A then indicates that he
pushed Staff Person 1 to the floor and that he continued to attempt to
hit Staff Person 1. Youth A reports Staff Person 2 and other residents
came over and pulled Youth A off of Staff Person 1. Youth A states no
one initially saw what had transpired between he and Staff Person 1.
Youth A states he does not know how he got the scratch to the side of
his neck, stating it could have occurred from Staff Person 1 or when
others were pulling him off of Staff Person 1.
I interviewed Staff Person 1 via telephone on 01/19/2023. He reports
terminating his employment with the facility for reasons not related to
this investigation. He was employed by the facility for five months and
received behavior management training. He reports standing in the
doorway by the parking lot when Youth A was attempting to AWOL
from the building. He recalls Youth A say that he was going to kill Staff
Person 1 and began spitting at him. Staff Person 1 states Youth A
started to charge at him and that he placed himself in a protective
stance. Youth A swung at Staff Person 1 with his casted arm and kept
punching at him when he tripped on his shoelaces causing him to fall to
the ground. Staff Person 1 states he held up his left hand, blocking
Youth A’s swings with his cast, and notes Staff Person 2 and other
4

residents pulled Youth A off him. Staff Person 1 denies telling Youth A
that he will kill Youth A and states that is what Youth A kept telling him.
Staff Person 1 also denies punching at Youth A and states that Youth A
pushed and started punching him causing him to fall to the floor and got
on top of him and continued to hit him with his cast. Staff Person 1
states he contacted the police and filed a report.
I interviewed Staff Person 2 onsite on 01/10/2023 with DHHS Worker.
She reports being employed by the facility for one year and up to date
on her behavior management training. She reports entering the
hallway with an unknown number of residents to see Youth A on top of
Staff Person 1 swinging at him. She states that she, Staff Person 3,
and some of the residents pulled Youth A off Staff Person 1. She did
not observe how Youth A got to be on top of Staff Person 1, though
heard that Youth A propped the door to AWOL, and that he spit at and
started to hit Staff Person 1 in the process.
I interviewed Youths B and C onsite on 01/10/2023 with DHHS Worker.
They do not report having any problems with Staff Person 1 or with the
facility.
There is no video surveillance to review.
Analysis There is no conclusive evidence to indicate that Staff Person 1
threatened to kill Youth A or push him as Youth A alleges. Youth A was
planning to AWOL from the facility and propped the door for his return
when Staff Person 1 intervened. Youth A then spit at and pushed Staff
Person 1 causing him to fall and began punching him with Youth A's
cast before being pulled off by staff and other residents.
Consultation: Staff are not to permit or encourage residents to restrain other
residents.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
